page.title: 10HULLS TELEPHONE SERVICE
page.content: 1985 is the 80th anniversary of Hulls Municipal Telephone service, it is now the only independent telephone service in Britain. There are now 182,000 telephones serving a population of 372,605. The area covered is larger than the city boundary, it includes many of the villages outside the city, covering some 120 square miles. The service also has 424 public phone boxes and 1083 rented coin phones. The future looks promising as with the privatisation of British Telecom Hulls independence remains assured. Also the service is to be improved with the replacement of the old Stowger and Crossbar exchange system with the new System X built by Plessey/GEC. This new system uses microchip technology and is being phased into the existing system slowly over the next 3 years.
